intro: Lindernia longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Lindernia longituba is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
